Posts.Content: Hi loubaby I have been on tamoxifen for 16 months . My side effects have been minimal although am struggling with joint pain- knees and hips mostly - also been prescribed vit D . Taken up yoga and Pilates to help keep myself as supple as possible.  Different brands definitely make a difference but I guess it's finding one that suits you . Mood swings and hot  flushes not too bad but I find I can't sleep if I take at night so take mine with breakfast . Not the best thing in the world but my GP says it's a wonder drug so I m persevering .....  Good luck with it all !! Gilikins ❤
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Hi loubaby I have been on tamoxifen for 16 months . My side effects have been minimal although am struggling with joint pain- knees and hips mostly - also been prescribed vit D . Taken up yoga and Pilates to help keep myself as supple as possible.  Different brands definitely make a difference but I guess it's finding one that suits you . Mood swings and hot  flushes not too bad but I find I can't sleep if I take at night so take mine with breakfast . Not the best thing in the world but my GP says it's a wonder drug so I m persevering .....  Good luck with it all !! Gilikins ❤
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Hiya I have been on tamoxifen for 16 months after full mastectomy chemo and rads.  I still have very achy knees and shoulders .I have been given vitamin D by my GP .It has helped actually . I find the mood swings worse than any other side effect though . Thought this might subside but seems to be getting worse . Anyone else struggling with this -sometimes I feel like a completely different person - can't function .
Posts.Title: Aches and pains ....... still!!!

Posts.Content: Yes definitely the different manufacturer makes a difference . I m on Teva which is better than other I have tried . Might try the make you suggest Dwbs .As far as the menopausal dwarves I am all of them on  most days!! No wonder my husband is confused !think we should market the Tom Nick name x it's certainly made me smile and smiling is so necessary !!
Posts.Title: Aches and pains ....... still!!!

Posts.Content: I m going to try that x what a great way of thinking . You must live with my husband !He constantly leaves his wardrobe door open .....
Posts.Title: Aches and pains ....... still!!!

Posts.Content: Have you tried acupuncture?  I have a friend who suffered like you are and she found it really helped xx
Posts.Title: Aches and pains ....... still!!!

Posts.Content: Thankyou X am keeping as busy as I can but it is emotionally exhausting X good to talk with people who know and understand .Am going to  my daughter's announcement of her pregnancy today xxx
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: I am trying to get myself to think positively . Had a gorgeous day out with my family to Ascot today and that has helped   I am dreading Monday but need to know . I too have been taking anti anxiety pills .....at least I don't have to wait too much longer to find out what I m having  Sending love and hope you can find some peace of mind soon Will let you know how it goes on Monday  Gill xxx
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Thankyou  Ian feeling much better but until I know definitely I can't get it out of my head.  Could you ring and ask if your CT could be bought forward ? Do you have a breast care nurse that could help with putting a bit of pressure on .....it really isn't acceptable for you to have to wait like this. When I got to my appointment yesterday they had already referred me for the biopsy and marked it as urgent . It's worth a try ... Hope you are getting lots of support from family and friends too I ll be in touch Mean while enjoy the sunshine
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Hey Winney How are you ?  Had a call from my oncologist today . The sternum hotspot isn't cancer mets !!! It's my seatbelt injury .... So so relieved  Wanted to let you know  Have you heard any more yet ? Been thinking of you  Gill xx
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Hello everyone Been busy getting on with life after my reconstruction and enjoying every minute.  Now my life has been turned upside down again after a bone scan and CT show concerns on my sternum Bone scan saying a marked focal uptake on left hand side and CT corroborates by saying a slight thickening suggestive of metastasisin the same area. Very non specific language used on the reports...."suggestive of "and "indeterminate" Seeing oncologist on 25th June . Has anyone else been through this ? I had a seatbelt injury 4years ago and bone scan identifies the light up area as where the sternum was damaged so holding onto that to keep me sane  All other areas of scan are clear except slight arthritis in my hip  Wise words would be welcome just now as going out of my mind with worry
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Thankyou These posts do help with the waiting I have sent a friend request I think X  Am trying very hard not to give in to the worry
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear this Winney, I am normally an extremely positive person but this has taken my confidence completely . More tests means more waiting for us both and that's the awful bit .  I m keeping everything crossed for us both.  Please let me know how you get on  Lots of love Gilikins
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Hiya Had scans due to pain in my hips  Ironically nothing there X  Wasn't expecting anything in sternum . No pain or any other symptoms . Just waiting that's so difficult   Thanks for the panda pictures xxxx
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Hey, End of July is far too long .....how are you coping with the waiting. I am really struggling ....can't function and have stayed off work these last couple of days .  I feel so stupid getting myself into such a state but seriously can't stop  Really hope you don't have to wait too long .. it helps to know that others understand . I m thinking of you Gill xx
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Hi Winney,  how are you doing ? I have to have my bone biopsy on July 10th ... so waiting is nearly over for me .  Any news on your bone scan results ?  Thinking of you and sending love .  Gill
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Hi Winney Just thinking of you and wondering how you're doing ? Did you get your scan ? I ve had an MRI today as the oncologist has decide it is more appropriate .....once they knew about my seat belt injury. Waiting again for me but I feel like I m getting closer now to a decision one way or the other it's been 3months since the original bone scan so it's such a worry from the view point of starting treatment should I need to . Keep in touch and let me know how it's going for you ? Hugs Gill
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Well ...we ve both had good news then ? That's how it is I guess ...day at a timeso glad we both have positive outcomes xx Will keep in touch Gill XXX
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Hello So oncogist has said I need bone biopsy . He also says that thickening of the sternum can be as a result of radiotherapy previous trauma and full reconstruction . I feel more positive now and am waiting for the biopsies to ascertain what it actually is . Did you have any of these ? Reconstruction actually causes the thickening if the sternum sometimes Thinking of you   Gill xx
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: I claimed PIPS during chemo.  Didn't know I was entitled to it but when I enquired about ESA the lovely lady who dealt with my claim gave me all the details. It is a matter of calling the benefits agency and they send out forms for you to complete.  Relatively easy from memory and every little helps. You have enough to worry about without having financial worries too so claim x
Posts.Title: PIPS application
